name: Man Page Navigation
description: Learn essential keyboard shortcuts for navigating manual pages

flashcards.question: How do you scroll backward one full screen in the man pages?
flashcards.example: To revisit the previous content in a man page, press PageUp.

flashcards.question: What command scrolls forward one line in the man pages?
flashcards.example: Use the DownArrow to move down one line at a time while reading.

flashcards.question: How do you scroll backward one line in the man pages?
flashcards.example: Press UpArrow to move up one line in the man page.

flashcards.question: What keyboard shortcut scrolls forward half a screen in the man pages?
flashcards.example: While viewing, press D to move forward by half a screen of text.

flashcards.question: How do you scroll backward half a screen in the man pages?
flashcards.example: Press U to move backward by half a screen.

flashcards.question: How do you search forward for a specific string in a man page?
flashcards.answer: Type /string and press Enter, replacing string with your search term.
flashcards.example:
To search for "passwd" in the man page:
/passwd
Press Enter to start the search.

flashcards.question: What command repeats the previous search forward in a man page?
flashcards.example: After an initial search, press n to find the next occurrence.

flashcards.question: How do you repeat the previous search backward in a man page?
flashcards.example: Press Shift+N to search for the previous occurrence of the term.

flashcards.question: How do you go to the start of a man page?
flashcards.example: At any point, press g to jump to the beginning.

flashcards.question: What command goes to the end of a man page?
flashcards.example: Press Shift+G to navigate directly to the end.
